gurmukhi: ਚਲੀ ਸੱਕਤ ਸੀਘ੍ਰ ਸੀ ਕ੍ਰਿਪਾਣਿ ਪਾਣਿ ਧਾਰ ਕੈ ॥
transliteration: Chaloo Sakkat Sooghra Soo Kridaan(i) Paan(i) Dhaar Kai||
translation: Immediately the powers wore the sword and went towards the arena of war;

gurmukhi: ੳੁਠੇ ਸੁ ਗ੍ਰਿੱਧ ਬ੍ਰਿੱਧ ਡੳੁਰ ਡਾਕਣੀ ਡਕਾਰ ਕੈ ॥
transliteration: Outhe Su Griddh Briddh Daur Daakanoo Dakaar Kai||
translation: And with them ran the great vultures nd belching vampires.

gurmukhi: ਹਸੇ ਸੁ ਕੰਕ ਬੰਕਯੋ ਕਬੰਧ ਅੰਧ ੳੁੱਠਹੀ ॥
transliteration: Hase Su Kank Bankayo Kabandh Andh Outth-hoo||
translation: The terrible crows smiled and the blind headless bodies also moved.

gurmukhi: ਬਿਸੇਖ ਦੇਵਤਾ ਰੁ ਬੀਰ ਬਾਣ ਧਾਰ ਬੁੱਠਹੀ ॥੨੫॥੧੪੭॥
transliteration: Bisekh Devtaa Ru Boor Baan Dhaar Boutth-hoo||25||147||
translation: From this side, the gods and other heroes began to shower shafts.25.147.

gurmukhi: ਸਬੈ ਸਕਤ ਅੈ ਕੈ ॥ ਚਲੀ ਸੀਸ ਨਿਅੈ ਕੈ ॥
transliteration: Sabai Sakat Ai Kai|| Chaloo Soos Niai Kai||
translation: All the powers came and went back paying their obeisance.

gurmukhi: ਮਹਾਂ ਅਸਤ੍ਰ ਧਾਰੇ ॥ ਮਹਾਂ ਬੀਰ ਮਾਰੇ ॥੨੬॥੧੪੮॥
transliteration: Mahaan Astra Dhdare|| Mahaan Boor Mdare||26||148||
translation: They wore terrible arms and killed many great warriors.26.148.

gurmukhi: ਮੁਖੰ ਰਕਤ ਨੈਣੰ ॥ ਬਕੈ ਬੰਕ ਬੈਣੰ ॥
translation: Their faces and eyes are reddened with blood and they are uttering challenging words from their mouths.
They are holding arms, daggers and swords in their hands.27.149.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਤੈ ਦੈਤ ਗਾਜੇ ॥ ਤੁਰੀ ਨਾਦ ਬਾਜੇ ॥
transliteration: Outai Dait Gadje|| Turoo Naad Baaje||
translation: From the other side, the demons are thundering, and the trumpets are resounding.

gurmukhi: ਧਰੇ ਚਾਰ ਚਰਮੰ ॥ ਸ੍ਰਜੇ ਕ੍ਰੂਰ ਬਰਮੰ ॥੨੮॥੧੫੦॥
transliteration: Ddare Chaar Charamannd|| Sraje Kroor Baramannd||28||150||
translation: They are wearing cruel armour, holding winsome shields in their hands.28.150.

gurmukhi: ਚਹੁੰ ਓਰ ਗਰਜੇ ॥ ਸਭੈ ਦੇਵ ਲਰਜੇ ॥
transliteration: Chahoon Or Gadje|| Sabhai Dev Larje||
translation: They began to roar from all the four sides and hearing their voices, all the gods trembled.

gurmukhi: ਛੁਟੇ ਤਿੱਛ ਤੀਰੰ ॥ ਕਟੇ ਚੳੁਰ ਚੀਰੰ ॥੨੯॥੧੫੧॥
transliteration: Chhoute Tichchh Tooran|| Kate Chaur Chooran||29||151||
translation: The sharp arrows were shot and the garments and fly-whisks were torn.29.151.

gurmukhi: ਰਸੰ ਰੁੱਦ੍ਰ ਮੱਤੇ ॥ ਮਹਾਂ ਤੇਜ ਤੱਤੇ ॥
transliteration: Rasan Ruddra Matte|| Mahaan Tej Tatte||
translation: Inebriated with extreme ferocity, the warriors are seen with brightened faces.
